items.title: neovim: enable structured attributes

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add nixos-rebuild repl, which loads a nix repl for you.

If you use flakes, brings the flake itself into scope as well.

Apologies to the non-flake users; your repl isn't quite as fancy, but at least evaluates your config exactly as you would expect, unlike flakes which are only evaluated impurely for now.

Tested by hand, as evaluating in the sandbox is tricky.

Try it

Flake in ~/config

nix run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl --flake ~/config

Non-flake

nix --extra-experimental-features flakes\ nix-command run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl
Things done

    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This adds the deepfilter-ladspa package, as well as nixos modules for using it and/or rnnoise with pipewire.

Closes #236646.

I've tested the modules on my own nixos system.

items.content_html:
Bot-based backport to release-23.05, triggered by a label in #240082.

  • Before merging, ensure that this backport complies with the Criteria for Backporting.
    • Even as a non-commiter, if you find that it does not comply, leave a comment.
items.title: [Backport release-23.05] neovim: add perl to supported providers

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This adds a NixOS module for Soft Serve, a tasty, self-hostable Git server for the command line.

The module has a test that checks some basic things like creating users, creating a repo and cloning it. Bash is required for running the hook scripts (e.g., on push), so I added it to the path of the wrapper.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add nixos module for unpackerr. Software is already in nixpkgs, just needed nixos config

Works for me, I left default user/group set to nobody/nogroup because this needs to run as the owner of archive files so there is no good default

items.content_html:
Runs dbus-update-activation-environment and systemctl import-environment on session start to ensure xdg portals work, and user services have correct PATH / XDG env vars. Matches behavior of Plasma/Gnome sessions.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

My usecase is that I want to set a common set of headers for all server without repeating them or knowing which virtual hosts exist. This basically mirrors virtualHosts.extraConfig without setting it on every virtualHost

items.title: nixos/nginx: add commonServerConfig option

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This is an early draft to add a package and module for Immich, a very popular self-hosted photo and video backup solution. I would appreciate any feedback on module ergonomics. So far, all important settings are already exposed in the module and the packages should build correctly.

  • Depends on #244233
  • Depends on #244655 (currently includes a workaround that can be removed once this is merged)

TODOs:

  • The nixos test would require network access and could benefit from persisting the machine learning models if that is possible (otherwise this is a multi-GB download each time the test is run)
  • Uploading images / videos could invoke external tools such as ffmpeg, exiftool, ..., and at this point I haven't tested if all required tools are propagated.
  • An update script is required to also update the sub-packages and their npmDepHashes.
  • aarch64 support should be possible and should be tested.
Things done

Early draft, not everything can be tested yet.
